metadata.title: CVE-2013-7464 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In csrf-magic before 1.0.4, if $GLOBALS['csrf']['secret'] is notconfigured, the Anti-CSRF Token used is predictable and would permit anattacker to bypass the CSRF protections, because an automatically generatedsecret is not used.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cacti - 0.8.8b+dfsg-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cacti package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.8b+dfsg-6').
